The OECD </span><span><a href="https://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/sites/0d1d1e2e-en/1/3/1/index.html?itemId=/content/publication/0d1d1e2e-en&_csp_=bfaa0426ac4b641531f10226ccc9a886&itemIGO=oecd&itemContentType=#figure-d1e889&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">projected</a></span><span> in its Economic Outlook report that inflation in advanced countries is likely to remain low in 2020 and 2021.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/10/economists-search-signs-economic-recovery-alternative-datasets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Economists Search for Meaning
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Conveyor belt with a car, plane, and toothpaste on it" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzA1L2Vjb25vbWljX2luZGljYXRvcnMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Economists typically rely on government data from previous months to understand the health of the current economy. But when life a few months ago bears the same resemblance to the current day as a P90X “before and after” photo, economists have been forced to <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/74b8160e-a9aa-11ea-abfc-5d8dc4dd86f9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">look elsewhere</a> to piece together a picture of a broken economy. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Like a John Candy film</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plane, train, and automobile data have been important indicators of the economy’s pace of recovery. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Planes:</strong></span><span> After processing a low of fewer than 90,000 travelers on April 14, TSA says more than </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/08/business/airlines-summer-travel-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">440,000 people</a></span><span> passed through its airport checkpoints last Sunday. That's progress—but still represents just 17% of last year's number.  </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Trains:</strong></span><span> Some railroad categories have had a "</span><span><a href="https://www.progressiverailroading.com/rail_industry_trends/news/AAR-Heartening-signs-in-May-rail-traffic-data--60610?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">heartening</a></span><span>" increase in traffic over last year, according to Association of American Railroads exec John Gray. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">And automobiles</strong></span><span>: The four-week moving average of petroleum demand has rebounded off its April low, while Apple’s </span><span><a href="https://www.apple.com/covid19/mobility?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mobility datasets</a></span><span> show more people are approaching their pre-pandemic driving levels. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Say “Ahhhhh”</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s weird, but dentist offices are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/10/upshot/dentists-coronavirus-economic-indicator.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">excellent indicators</a> of economic as well as gum health.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“If you look at your typical dentist office, nothing went wrong with their business model,” Betsey Stevenson, an economics professor at the University of Michigan told the NYT. “It’s just coronavirus that happened.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Therefore, dentistry employment figures give a good sense of how fast the economy is bouncing back from the pandemic. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">And it's bouncing: </strong></span><span>Data gathered by the American Dental Association showed that 45% of dentists had laid off their entire staffs by mid-April. But after the first week of June, 77% of dentist offices have rehired their full staff. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s it all mean? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This “alternative” data for economists is kinda like Tom Brady’s successor in New England...way less reliable. But increased movement of goods and people coupled with the revival of previously shuttered offices shows that things are at least trending in a positive direction.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/10/fed-pledges-support-economy-not-hike-interest-rates-2022?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fed: This Could Take Awhile
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Cookie Monster tapping his fingers " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/o5oLImoQgGsKY/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Cookie Monster tapping his fingers " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/o5oLImoQgGsKY/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Despite that encouraging activity, the Fed concluded its meeting yesterday by acknowledging we have a loooooooong way to go.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">First things first: </strong>The central bank did <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/10/fed-meeting-decision-interest-rates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not move interest rates</a>, and in fact does not intend to hike them through 2022. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Fed raises and lowers interest rates (aka borrowing costs) to prevent the U.S. economy from either overheating or slowing down too much. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In March, the Fed dropped rates to near 0 as the pandemic began to whack the U.S. That they’ll stay there for years means this recovery will take...years. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">GDP projections: </strong>The Fed predicts GDP will <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/10/business/stock-market-today-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fall 6.5%</a> in 2020, followed by a 5% gain in 2021. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>If you’re looking for a reason the market has bounced back like a boomerang, you might want to focus less on Robinhood day traders and more on the Fed, which stepped in with extraordinary measures to keep markets functioning properly—which it made clear it will continue.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This does not look like a “V” shaped recovery.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/10/amazon-stops-giving-police-access-rekognition-one-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Headlines About Head Lines
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a <a href="https://blog.aboutamazon.com/policy/we-are-implementing-a-one-year-moratorium-on-police-use-of-rekognition?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blog post</a> yesterday, Amazon said it will stop giving law enforcement access to its facial recognition technology, Rekognition, for one year. The company says the moratorium will give Congress time to figure out more oversight over this powerful but controversial tool.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Set the scene: </strong>The move comes during a time of greater awareness of state surveillance and systemic racism following the killing of George Floyd. And Rekognition fits squarely between those two issues. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>After it was revealed Amazon pitched the tool to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), the ACLU </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2018/12/06/how-amazon-rekognition-works-and-what-its-used-for.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">thrashed the company</a></span><span> for its role in "automating mass surveillance." </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last year, researchers at the MIT Media Lab </span><span><a href="https://medium.com/@Joy.Buolamwini/response-racial-and-gender-bias-in-amazon-rekognition-commercial-ai-system-for-analyzing-faces-a289222eeced?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">concluded</a></span><span> that Rekognition exhibits "gender and racial bias for gender classification." Amazon said researchers ran flawed tests and weren't using the most up-to-date versions of the tech. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Amazon is still bullish on facial recognition tech, but it realizes now may not be the best time politically to pitch it to law enforcement. Earlier this week IBM said it was exiting the facial recognition business entirely. </p>

<img alt="Bubba Wallace " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzA5L2J1YmJhX3dhbGxhY2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Chris Graythen/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NASCAR has banned the Confederate flag from its events and properties. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"The presence of the Confederate flag at NASCAR events runs contrary to our commitment to providing a welcoming and inclusive environment for all fans, our competitors and our industry," the organization </span><span><a href="https://www.espn.com/racing/nascar/story/_/id/29293767/nascar-bans-confederate-flags-racetracks?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> ahead of last night's race at Martinsville Speedway.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Bubba Wallace, the circuit's only full-time black driver (shown above), called on NASCAR to remove the Confederate flag this week, saying "it's time for change." He drove in a Chevy outfitted with a special <a href="https://www.si.com/extra-mustard/2020/06/10/nascar-bubba-wallace-black-lives-matter-car-paint-martinsville?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">#BlackLivesMatter paint scheme</a> last night.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD DELIVERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/10/just-eat-takeaway-close-buying-grubhub?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Grubhub Purchase Is Here
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Dutch delivery giant Just Eat Takeaway agreed to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-grubhub-m-a-just-eat-takeaway-purchas/europes-just-eat-takeaway-to-buy-u-s-delivery-firm-grubhub-for-7-3-billion-idUSKBN23H3F6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquire</a> U.S. delivery regular-sized person Grubhub for $7.3 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just Eat Takeaway knows its way around a Styrofoam box. It has <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90515270/grubhub-and-just-eat-are-in-advanced-merger-talks-in-what-could-be-a-new-headache-for-restaurants?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delivery operations</a> in 10 European countries plus Israel. Its approach is best summed up by CEO Jitse Groen’s 2018 comment to Bloomberg: “The most value is in being the largest, by far.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We know one ride-hailing company that’s less than pleased. </strong>Uber had been making eyes at Grubhub for months...but U.S. lawmakers <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90507691/backlash-to-rumored-uber-grubhub-merger-gets-louder?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sicced</a> the DOJ and FTC on the deal, arguing it would reduce competition. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Despite a boost in demand from lockdown restrictions, Grubhub has struggled to protect its 23% U.S. market share from Uber Eats and DoorDash. It also has yet to turn a profit (it lost $33 million in Q1), which likely turned up the pressure to find a buyer. Now, it's Just Eat's ticket to the U.S. market. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/10/video-app-zynn-faces-accusations-plagiarism?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Plagiarism Is a Zynn
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chinese video app Zynn is lighting up Turnitin.com. Google removed the TikTok lookalike from its Play Store yesterday after some TikTok creators saw <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/10/21286256/zynn-tiktok-clone-play-store-google-apple-removed-plagiarism?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">clones of their profiles</a> appear on Zynn without their consent. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Zynn is the Mary-Kate to TikTok’s Ashley</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With one key difference. Zynn actually pays people to watch videos and recruit other users to the app, a tactic that propelled Zynn to the <a href="https://sensortower.com/ios/rankings/top/iphone/us/all-categories?date=2020-05-27&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top of the free app charts</a> in May—even beating out TikTok. If that sounds too good to be true, you might be right. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Common Sense Media has labeled Zynn a “pyramid scheme,” while some users have reported issues receiving the money they earned. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The U.S. isn't exactly laying out the red carpet. Earlier this week, lawmakers reopened their <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/10/24/tiktok-raises-national-security-concerns-congress-schumer-cotton-ask-federal-review/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TikTok playbook</a>, calling on the Federal Trade Commission to investigate Zynn as potentially empowering Chinese leadership to “pry into the private affairs of Americans.”</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The real cost of sending money abroad:</strong> It can cost a person in the UK nearly £30 to send £100 to the United States. How? And why would anyone pay for that? Here’s a <a href="https://builtformars.co.uk/banks/international/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fascinating report</a> exclusive to Morning Brew in the U.S. that walks you through the process of making an international payment.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some entertainment: </strong>David Byrne <a href="http://davidbyrne.com/radio" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">radio</a>, <a href="https://digg.com/video/here-are-all-of-the-wonderfully-uncomfortable-bloopers-from-zach-galifianakiss-between-two-ferns?utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bloopers</a> from <em>Between Two Ferns</em>, and this Bruce Lee <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-R7SZ1wgNY" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">documentary</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;">*This is sponsored advertising content. Meaning\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Conveyor belt with a car, plane, and toothpaste on it\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzA1L2Vjb25vbWljX2luZGljYXRvcnMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEconomists typically rely on government data from previous months to understand the health of the current economy. But when life a few months ago bears the same resemblance to the current day as a P90X “before and after” photo, economists have been forced to \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/74b8160e-a9aa-11ea-abfc-5d8dc4dd86f9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elook elsewhere\u003c/a\u003e to piece together a picture of a broken economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLike a John Candy film\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlane, train, and automobile data have been important indicators of the economy’s pace of recovery. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePlanes:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e After processing a low of fewer than 90,000 travelers on April 14, TSA says more than \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/08/business/airlines-summer-travel-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e440,000 people\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e passed through its airport checkpoints last Sunday. That's progress—but still represents just 17% of last year's number.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrains:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Some railroad categories have had a \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.progressiverailroading.com/rail_industry_trends/news/AAR-Heartening-signs-in-May-rail-traffic-data--60610?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheartening\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\" increase in traffic over last year, according to Association of American Railroads exec John Gray. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd automobiles\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: The four-week moving average of petroleum demand has rebounded off its April low, while Apple’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.apple.com/covid19/mobility?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emobility datasets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e show more people are approaching their pre-pandemic driving levels. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSay “Ahhhhh”\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s weird, but dentist offices are \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/10/upshot/dentists-coronavirus-economic-indicator.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexcellent indicators\u003c/a\u003e of economic as well as gum health.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“If you look at your typical dentist office, nothing went wrong with their business model,” Betsey Stevenson, an economics professor at the University of Michigan told the NYT. “It’s just coronavirus that happened.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTherefore, dentistry employment figures give a good sense of how fast the economy is bouncing back from the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd it's bouncing: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eData gathered by the American Dental Association showed that 45% of dentists had laid off their entire staffs by mid-April. But after the first week of June, 77% of dentist offices have rehired their full staff. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s it all mean? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis “alternative” data for economists is kinda like Tom Brady’s successor in New England...way less reliable. But increased movement of goods and people coupled with the revival of previously shuttered offices shows that things are at least trending in a positive direction.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDespite that encouraging activity, the Fed concluded its meeting yesterday by acknowledging we have a loooooooong way to go.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFirst things first: \u003c/strong\u003eThe central bank did \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/10/fed-meeting-decision-interest-rates.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot move interest rates\u003c/a\u003e, and in fact does not intend to hike them through 2022. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Fed raises and lowers interest rates (aka borrowing costs) to prevent the U.S. economy from either overheating or slowing down too much. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn March, the Fed dropped rates to near 0 as the pandemic began to whack the U.S. That they’ll stay there for years means this recovery will take...years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGDP projections: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Fed predicts GDP will \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/10/business/stock-market-today-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efall 6.5%\u003c/a\u003e in 2020, followed by a 5% gain in 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you’re looking for a reason the market has bounced back like a boomerang, you might want to focus less on Robinhood day traders and more on the Fed, which stepped in with extraordinary measures to keep markets functioning properly—which it made clear it will continue.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis does not look like a “V” shaped recovery.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHeadlines About Head Lines\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a \u003ca href=\"https://blog.aboutamazon.com/policy/we-are-implementing-a-one-year-moratorium-on-police-use-of-rekognition?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblog post\u003c/a\u003e yesterday, Amazon said it will stop giving law enforcement access to its facial recognition technology, Rekognition, for one year. The company says the moratorium will give Congress time to figure out more oversight over this powerful but controversial tool.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSet the scene: \u003c/strong\u003eThe move comes during a time of greater awareness of state surveillance and systemic racism following the killing of George Floyd. And Rekognition fits squarely between those two issues. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAfter it was revealed Amazon pitched the tool to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), the ACLU \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2018/12/06/how-amazon-rekognition-works-and-what-its-used-for.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethrashed the company\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for its role in \"automating mass surveillance.\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast year, researchers at the MIT Media Lab \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/@Joy.Buolamwini/response-racial-and-gender-bias-in-amazon-rekognition-commercial-ai-system-for-analyzing-faces-a289222eeced?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econcluded\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that Rekognition exhibits \"gender and racial bias for gender classification.\" Amazon said researchers ran flawed tests and weren't using the most up-to-date versions of the tech. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Amazon is still bullish on facial recognition tech, but it realizes now may not be the best time politically to pitch it to law enforcement. Earlier this week IBM said it was exiting the facial recognition business entirely. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" It has \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90515270/grubhub-and-just-eat-are-in-advanced-merger-talks-in-what-could-be-a-new-headache-for-restaurants?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edelivery operations\u003c/a\u003e in 10 European countries plus Israel. Its approach is best summed up by CEO Jitse Groen’s 2018 comment to Bloomberg: “The most value is in being the largest, by far.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe know one ride-hailing company that’s less than pleased. \u003c/strong\u003eUber had been making eyes at Grubhub for months...but U.S. lawmakers \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90507691/backlash-to-rumored-uber-grubhub-merger-gets-louder?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esicced\u003c/a\u003e the DOJ and FTC on the deal, arguing it would reduce competition. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite a boost in demand from lockdown restrictions, Grubhub has struggled to protect its 23% U.S. market share from Uber Eats and DoorDash. It also has yet to turn a profit (it lost $33 million in Q1), which likely turned up the pressure to find a buyer.
